intro: Jussiaea nervosa stirps ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf jussiaea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetland or riparian habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
